abstract.para: The topic describes who is able to login to &cockpit; and switching to elevated privileges tasks.

topic.para: You do not need separate credentials to log in to &cockpit;. Use the same credentials that you use to log in to &productname;. However, on new installations login using &rootuser; is not allowed by default. Either you can enable login &rootuser; with a password as described in , or you create a non-privileged user to access &cockpit;. On instances upgraded from a previous release, &rootuser; login is still allowed. In all cases, we recommend to enhance the security by adding 2FA as described in .

Non-privileged users log in to &cockpit; with limited access. To perform administrative tasks, click Limited access in the top-right menu and unlock the administrative mode by entering &rootuser; password.
